intro: Sanicula menziesii, commonly known as the western pipevine, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants with characteristic umbellate flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbrella-like clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and streambanks. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to nutrient-rich soils, supporting its growth in woodland habitats.
